bio:treatment.discussion: Genera 22, species 225 (9 genera, 38 species in the flora):

Circumscription of Pectidinae has been fairly constant for decades. The group is sometimes given tribal rank, as Tageteae. Here, we have followed H. Robinson (1981). The group is usually distinguished on the basis of schizogenous glands containing essential oils (mostly terpenes) in tissues of leaves and/or phyllaries (sometimes in tissues of other organs as well).

references.reference: Strother, J. L. 1969. Systematics of Dyssodia Cavanilles (Compositae: Tageteae). Univ. Calif. Publ. Bot. 48: 1–88.
Strother, J. L. 1986. Renovation of Dyssodia (Compositae: Tageteae). Sida 11: 371–378.

key_statement.description: Leaves opposite (blade margins proximally bristly-ciliate; ray florets borne on bases ofsubtending phyllaries; style branches of bisexual florets knoblike)

Leaves opposite or mostly alternate (blades often lobed, margins sometimes bristly-ciliate; ray florets borne on receptacles, not on bases of subtending phyllaries; style branches of bisexual florets linear).
Phyllaries distinct to bases or nearly so.
Calyculi of (0–)1–9, deltate, lanceolate, or linear bractlets; pappi wholly or partly of scales (individual scales sometimes comprising 5–10, basally connate bristles).
Ray corollas whitish with pinkish or purplish stripes
Calyculi 0; pappi wholly of distinct bristles.
Phyllaries ± connate 1 / 3 – 7 / 8 + their lengths (margins of outer may be free to bases).
Calyculi 0; pappi of 2–5(–10) elements in ± 1 series (usually 0–5+ oblong to lanceolate, erose-truncate to laciniate, plus 0–2+ longer, subulate or aristate, some or all sometimes connate)
Calyculi usually of (1–)5–8(–22) bractlets, rarely 0; pappi usually of 8–20 elements in 2 series, rarely coroniform.
Bractlets of calyculi subulate or pectinate
Bractlets of calyculi (deltate to subulate) not pectinate.
Plants (20–)30–70+ cm; involucres (7–18 ×) 5–12 mm; phyllaries weakly connate 1 / 3 – 2 / 3 their lengths
Plants mostly (1–)5–30 cm; involucres (4–6 ×) 2–7 mm; phyllaries strongly connate 2 / 3 – 7 / 8 their lengths (margins of outer may be free to bases)
